sailpoint.object

Class ScoreItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.ScoreItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.IXmlEqualable<ScoreItem>, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class ScoreItem
extends AbstractXmlObject
implements sailpoint.tools.xml.IXmlEqualable<ScoreItem>
    A class holding information about one contributing factor to a risk score. These can be generated as a side effect of scoring, and displayed so that the viewer is given some indication of what they can do to lower the score.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCompositePercentage

        public int getCompositePercentage()
        Percentage of the composite score contributed by this item. This tells you how important this item was to the composite score.

      • setCompositePercentage

        public void setCompositePercentage(int i)

      • getTargetMessage

        public Message getTargetMessage()
        Brief description of the thing on which this item is most closely associated. These are not necessarily names of objects in the database, but should give the user a good idea of what the source of the score is.

      • setTargetMessage

        public void setTargetMessage(Message targetMessage)

      • getSuggestionMessage

        public Message getSuggestionMessage()
        Suggestion on what the user could do to reduce this score. This might not be necessary, at least not on a per-item basis since the suggestions for items of the same type will usually be the same, for example, "remediate this entitlement".

      • setSuggestionMessage

        public void setSuggestionMessage(Message suggestionMessage)

      • isRelated

        public boolean isRelated(ScoreDefinition def)
        Return true if this item is related to a given ScoreDefinition. Currently it is required that the score item type be the definition name.
